claim: We limited our search to articles and reviews in English, with Figure 1 illustrating the specific flow chart.
title: Figure 1.
caption: Flowchart for including and excluding publications.

claim: As depicted in Figure 2, the research interest in this field has shown a consistent and rapid upward trajectory.
title: Figure 2.
caption: Annual literature publication growth trends.

claim: Figure 3A showcases the yearly publication volumes across countries, where China and the United States outshine others in terms of output.
title: Figure 3.
caption: (A) Comparative analysis of publication volumes across major countries. (B) Collaboration network map among countries/regions using VOSviewer. (C) Timeline graphs displaying interactions among 88 countries/districts using VOSviewer the node size signifies the quantity of articles. Node color depicts the research topic, while lines connecting nodes indicate cooperative relationships between countries. A wider line between two nodes represents greater collaboration between the countries involved. Additionally, a node connected to numerous other nodes demonstrates its recognition and influence across multiple countries.

claim: Figure 3B elucidates the collaborative ties between countries.
title: Figure 3.
caption: (A) Comparative analysis of publication volumes across major countries. (B) Collaboration network map among countries/regions using VOSviewer. (C) Timeline graphs displaying interactions among 88 countries/districts using VOSviewer the node size signifies the quantity of articles. Node color depicts the research topic, while lines connecting nodes indicate cooperative relationships between countries. A wider line between two nodes represents greater collaboration between the countries involved. Additionally, a node connected to numerous other nodes demonstrates its recognition and influence across multiple countries.

claim: Figure 3C reveals the average research initiation time in this field for different countries.
title: Figure 3.
caption: (A) Comparative analysis of publication volumes across major countries. (B) Collaboration network map among countries/regions using VOSviewer. (C) Timeline graphs displaying interactions among 88 countries/districts using VOSviewer the node size signifies the quantity of articles. claim: Authors publishing on similar research topics were grouped into same-color clusters (Figure 4A).
title: Figure 4.
caption: (A) Collaboration network map among authors using VOSviewer. (B) Authors' production over time.

claim: To examine the recent publication patterns of these authors, we analyzed the publication volumes of the top 20 authors over the past decade (Figure 4B).
title: Figure 4.
caption: (A) Collaboration network map among authors using VOSviewer. (B) Authors' production over time.

claim: Figure 5A presents a density plot depicting the number of articles indexed by journals, where brighter colors signify a higher count of indexed articles.
title: Figure 5.
caption: (A) Density map of journal article distribution using VOSviewer. (B) Dual-map overlay of journals in CiteSpace: citing journals are on the left, cited journals are on the right, colored paths indicate citation relationships.

claim: Figure 5B offers a dual overlay of journals, illustrating the interconnectedness between various disciplines.
title: Figure 5.
caption: (A) Density map of journal article distribution using VOSviewer. (B) Dual-map overlay of journals in CiteSpace: citing journals are on the left, cited journals are on the right, colored paths indicate citation relationships.

claim: We also conducted a clustering analysis (Figure 7A) on the references to facilitate the identification of the theoretical basis for various research directions.
title: Figure 7.
caption: (A) The analysis of keyword clusters using citeSpace. (B) Top 25 references with the strongest citation bursts identified by citeSpace (2019–2023).

claim: Finally, we performed a burst analysis (Figure 7B) on the references from 2019 to 2023 to identify the articles that suddenly gained popularity in this field.
title: Figure 7.
caption: (A) The analysis of keyword clusters using citeSpace. (B) Top 25 references with the strongest citation bursts identified by citeSpace (2019–2023).
